Italian.Text: Unità di mech d'assalto:Unità di mech d'assalto

Spanish.Text: Unidad de mech de asalto:Unidades de mechs de asalto
Unidad de dreadnought:Unidades de dreadnought

Italian.Text: Unità per la guerra biologica:Unità per la guerra biologica

Spanish.Text: Unidad de guerra biológica:Unidades de guerra biológica
Unidad clon:Unidades clon

TEXT.English: Ambulances are used to heal units.
[TAB]The Apothecary provides his patients with medicinal herbs, which were very effective in healing the allergies, and raising and renewing the body vitality.

Use the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Apothecary[COLOR_REVERT] to heal troops. They are fast moving, but expensive to produce and maintain. The Apothecary starts out with the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Medic1[COLOR_REVERT] promotion. Additionally, Apothecary require the Apothecary's Shop in the city in which they are built. The Apothecary can be upgraded to an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Medic[COLOR_REVERT], after discovering Medicine.

[TAB]A bombard is a medieval cannon or mortar, used chiefly in sieges for throwing heavy stone balls. This weapon was usually used during sieges to hurl various forms of missile into enemy fortifications. Projectiles such as stone or metal balls, burning materials and weighted cloth soaked in quicklime or Greek fire are documented.
This early gunpower based seige unit is much more dangerous than the Catapult or Trebuchet.

[TAB]A [BOLD]Canoe[\BOLD] is a small narrow boat, typically human-powered, though it may also be powered by sails or small electric or gas motors. Canoes usually are pointed at both bow and stern and are normally open on top, but can be covered.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]In its human-powered form, the canoe is ordinarily propelled by the use of paddles, with the number of paddlers (most commonly two) dependent on the size of the canoe. Paddlers face in the direction of travel, either seated on supports in the hull, or kneeling directly upon the hull. Paddling can be contrasted with rowing, where the rowers usually face away from the direction of travel and use mounted oars (though a wide canoe can be fitted with oarlocks and rowed). Paddles may be single-bladed or double-bladed.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]The oldest recovered canoe in the world is the canoe of Pesse (Holland). According to C14 dating analysis it was constructed somewhere between 8200 and 7600 B.C. This canoe is exhibited in the Drents Museum in Assen, Netherlands.
Build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Canoes[COLOR_REVERT] to explore. You can also carry one unit on them.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Canoas[COLOR_REVERT] para explorar. También puedes llevar una unidad en ellas.

TEXT.English: This early naval unit (the Portuguese replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravel[COLOR_REVERT]) can transport both military and peaceful units, as well as explore enemy territory without penalty.

[TAB]These four-masted sailing ships were the first European ships able to reliably navigate the open ocean. Although small by modern standards, the Caravela afforded enough space for crew, cargo and small cannons. Its economy, speed, agility, and power made it esteemed as the best sailing vessel of its time.
This ocean going naval unit can transport both military and peaceful units.

[TAB]These four-masted sailing ships were the first European ships able to reliably navigate the open ocean. As the forerunner of the great ships of the age of sail, the carrack was one of the most influential ship designs in history; while ships became more specialized, the basic design remained unchanged throughout this time period, being large enough to be stable in heavy seas, and roomy enough to carry provisions for long voyages.

[TAB]The war elephant was first used in India and was known to the Persians by the 4th Century BC. Using war elephants, Candra Gupta defeated Alexander's successor Seleucus and established the Mauryan Empire. Though Carthage's African war elephants accomplished little subsequently, their presence in Hannibal's army during his transit of the Alps into the heart of Rome in 218 BC established their reputation as a fearsome weapon. The elephant's tactical importance apparently stemmed in large part from its willingness to charge both foot soldiers and cavalry and from the panic that it inspired. Although used in Indian military forces until the 20th Century, as with so many traditional weapons, the utility of elephants in war ended with the widespread use of gunpowder.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'utilisation des éléphants pour la guerre a commencé en Inde et était connue des Perses au IVe siècle av. J.-C. C'est grâce à ses éléphants de guerre que Chandragupta parvint à vaincre Seleucos, le successeur d'Alexandre le Grand, et à fonder l'Empire maurya. Même si les éléphants africains de Carthage ont peu d'exploits à leur actif, leur présence dans l'armée d'Hannibal lors de la traversée des Alpes en 218 av. J.-C. leur a valu une réputation d'arme redoutable. L'importance tactique des éléphants repose beaucoup sur leur capacité à attaquer l'infanterie comme la cavalerie, et à inspirer la terreur. Bien que les armées indiennes aient utilisé l'éléphant jusqu'au XXe siècle, son utilité dans la pratique de la guerre a pris fin avec l'invention de la poudre à canon.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Kriegselefant wurde zuerst in Indien eingesetzt und war den Persern im 4. Jahrhundert vor Christus schon geläufig. Mit Hilfe von Kriegselefanten gelang es dem indischen König Chandragupta, die Truppen von Seleukos, dem Nachfolger Alexanders des Großen, zu besiegen und das Maurya-Reich zu begründen. Auch wenn die afrikanischen Kriegselefanten der Karthager nur wenig ausrichten konnten, so machten sie ihrem Ruf als gefürchtetes Kriegsgerät alle Ehre, als Hannibal seine Truppen mitsamt den Dickhäutern über die Alpen führte, um im Jahre 218 vor Christus in Rom einzufallen. Die taktische Bedeutung der Kriegselefanten resultiert zum großen Teil aus ihrer Eigenschaft, sowohl Fußsoldaten als auch die Kavallerie anzugreifen und in Panik zu versetzen. Das indische Militär setzte sie zwar noch bis zum 20. Jahrhundert aktiv ein, letztlich erging es ihnen am Ende aber wie vielen anderen traditionellen "Waffen": Ihr militärischer Nutzen endete mit dem verbreiteten Einsatz von Schießpulver.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'elefante da guerra fu usato per la prima volta in India e fu conosciuto dai Persiani intorno al quarto secolo a. C. Grazie a queste unità, Candra Gupta sconfisse il successore di Alessandro, Seleuco, e fondò l'Impero Maurya. Anche se gli elefanti da guerra africani di Cartagine non furono determinanti, la loro presenza nell'esercito di Annibale durante la sua traversata delle Alpi verso il cuore di Roma, nel 218 a. C., affermò la loro reputazione di arma temibile. Apparentemente, l'importanza tattica dell'elefante si basa in gran parte sulla sua predisposizione a caricare sia i fanti che la cavalleria, nonché sul panico che è in grado di suscitare. Malgrado sia stato usato nelle truppe indiane fino al XX secolo, alla pari di molte armi tradizionali, la sua utilità in guerra è cessata con la diffusione della polvere da sparo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los elefantes de guerra fueron utilizados por primera vez en la India, y los persas ya lo conocían hacia el siglo IV a. C. Utilizando elefantes de guerra, Chandragupta derrotó a Seleuco, sucesor de Alejandro, y fundó el imperio mauryan. Aunque estos animales no sirvieron de mucho a Cartago, su presencia en el ejército de Aníbal durante el cruce de los Alpes y la invasión de Roma en el año 218 a. C. bastó para cimentar su reputación como armas terribles. La importancia táctica de los elefantes derivaba aparentemente de su disposición a cargar tanto contra la infantería como contra la caballería, y del pánico que esto inspiraba. Aunque sirvieron en el ejército indio hasta el siglo XX, su utilidad real, al igual que ocurrió con muchas otras armas tradicionales, terminó con la difusión generalizada de la pólvora.

TEXT.English: Well-suited unit against mounted and siege units. Gets bonus when attacking city and may also build roads and some other basic improvements.

[TAB]The English-language surname [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]"Fletcher"[COLOR_REVERT] derives from this term, meaning "one who fletches." It is sometimes generally used for an arrow-maker, not only for someone restricted to this step of the process.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fletchers[COLOR_REVERT] are early city law enforcement units who are capable of defending cities against light attacks, but are no substitue for a proper military defensive units.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Flecheros[COLOR_REVERT] como defensores de ciudades iniciales.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Doctors[COLOR_REVERT] can build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Military Academy[COLOR_REVERT], which greatly increases a city's research. They can also go into the field and assist different units by providing field hospitals or making them self sufficient in taking care of their own wounds.

[TAB]The jester is someone whose role is to entertain, often though mocking persons of high office through pointed comments. They wore distinctive brightly coloured clothing and typically a floppy three pointed hat representing a donkeys ears and tail.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Jesters[COLOR_REVERT] can perform a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Great Jest[COLOR_REVERT] which provides a temporary happiness boost to all your cities.

Spanish.Text: Gran mercader:Grandes mercaderes

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Healer provides his patients with medicinal herbs, which were very effective in healing the allergies, and raising and renewing the body vitality.

Use the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Healer[COLOR_REVERT] to heal troops. They are fast moving, but expensive to produce and maintain. Additionally, Healers require the Healer's Hut in the city in which they are built. The Healer can be upgraded to an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Apothecary[COLOR_REVERT], after discovering Education.

Spanish.Text: Caballería pesada:Caballerías pesadas

TEXT.English: [TAB]To put it simply, a Heavy Cavalry unit is better-armed and armored than its Light Cavalry cousin. The creation of Heavy Cavalry required a number of technological advances: first, larger horses had to be bred; then metal armor had to be made lighter and more flexible. All of these required a fairly wealthy and advanced civilization, but the price was well worth it: few unarmored cavalry units could hope to stand against the determined charge of Heavy Cavalry.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une unité de cavalerie lourde est mieux armée et mieux protégée qu'une unité de cavalerie légère. La création d'unités de cavalerie lourde nécessite de nombreuses avancées technologiques. Il faut des chevaux plus robustes. Les armures de métal doivent être plus légères et plus flexibles. Pour cela, il faut posséder une civilisation assez riche et avancée, mais cela en vaut la peine : une charge de cavalerie lourde peut venir à bout de la plupart des unités montées sans armure.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Um es einfach auszudrücken: Einheiten der Schweren Kavallerie sind besser bewaffnet und gepanzert als Einheiten der Leichten Kavallerie. Für die Erschaffung der Schweren Kavallerie waren einige technologische Errungenschaften notwendig. Zunächst mussten größere Pferde gezüchtet werden. Dann musste die metallene Rüstung leichter und flexibler gemacht werden. Zu all dessen bedurfte es einer recht wohlhabenden und fortschrittlichen Zivilisation, doch der hohe Preis war es wert: Nur wenige ungepanzerte Kavallerieeinheiten konnten darauf hoffen, einem energischen Angriff der Schweren Kavallerie standhalten zu können.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]In parole povere, un'unità di cavalleria pesante è più corazzata e meglio armata della cugina, la cavalleria leggera. La creazione della cavalleria pesante necessitò di diversi sviluppi: dovettero essere riprodotti dei cavalli più grandi, quindi fu necessario rendere più leggere e flessibili le armature. Ciò richiedeva civiltà abbastanza ricche ed evolute, ma ne valeva la pena: ben poche unità di cavalleria leggera avevano qualche possibilità di cavarsela davanti a una carica della cavalleria pesante.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En pocas palabras, una unidad de caballería pesada es una versión mejor armada y equipada de la caballería ligera. La creación de la caballería pesada requería una serie de avances tecnológicos: para empezar, caballos más grandes. Luego, era necesario que la armadura de metal fuera más liviana y flexible. Todo esto solo podía darse en civilizaciones opulentas y avanzadas, pero el resultado merecía la pena: pocas unidades de caballería no pesada podían resistir una carga de una de estas unidades.

TEXT.English: Good against melee units in the open and against Light Cavalry, Horse Archers, and Mounted Infantry.

French.Text: Unités efficaces en terrain dégagé contre les unités de combat rapproché, ainsi que contre la cavalerie légère, les archers montés et l'infanterie montée.

TEXT.German: Gut gegen Nahkampfeinheiten im Freien sowie gegen Leichte Kavallerie, Berittene Bogenschützen und Berittene Infanterie.

Italian.Text: Ottima su terreno aperto contro unità da combattimento ravvicinato e contro cavalleria leggera, arcieri a cavallo e fanteria a cavallo.

Spanish.Text: Es especialmente buena frente a unidades de cuerpo a cuerpo a campo abierto, así como frente a unidades de caballería ligera, arqueros a caballo e infantería montada.
Lacayo pesado

TEXT.English: Use to engage the heavy privateer and bombard city defences.

[TAB]The heavy frigate first built by the Unoted States Navy and could carry up to sixty guns on two decks. These were so welll armed that they were sometimes considered to be equal to Ships of the Line. Constitution and her sister ships President and United States were created in a response to deal with the Barbary Coast pirates and in conjunction with the Naval Act of 1794. The three big frigates, when built, had a distinctive building pattern which minimised "hogging" (in which the centre of the keel rises while both ends drop) and improves hydrodynamic efficiency.

[BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]These powerful units are particularly adept at battling mounted foes; they are also good at city-defense.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]With the failure of the Western Roman Empire, the city of Rome was nominally under the protection of Byzantium. However, the Byzantines did little to support Rome, and the Pope had to field his own army to defend the Holy City.[PARAGRAPH:1]Papal Pikemen are heavy spearmen. They are loosely based upon the Swiss Guard mercenary units that have defended the Vatican for the past five centuries (although the Guard actually appeared some 700 years after the events in this scenario).

French.Text: [BOLD]Stratégie :[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ces puissantes unités pontificales sont expertes dans l'art d'affronter les ennemis montés. Elles sont aussi efficaces pour défendre les villes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Histoire :[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Après l'effondrement de l'Empire romain d'Occident, la ville de Rome se retrouva placée sous la protection des Byzantins. Toutefois, les Byzantins ne firent pas grand-chose pour aider Rome, et le pape dut former sa propre armée pour défendre la ville sainte.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les piquiers pontificaux sont des lanciers lourds. Ils sont inspirés des mercenaires de la garde suisse du Vatican, même si cette garde apparut en fait sept siècles après les événements de ce scénario.

TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Diese starken päpstlichen Einheiten sind besonders geschickt im Kampf gegen berittene Feinde, und auch in der Städteverteidigung sind sie recht effektiv.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Mit dem Scheitern des Römischen Reiches stand die Stadt Rom theoretisch unter dem Schutze Konstantinopels. Die Byzantiner waren taten jedoch recht wenig, um Rom zu unterstützen, und der Papst sah sich gezwungen, eine eigene Armee aufzubauen, um die Heilige Stadt zu verteidigen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Päpstliche Pikeniere sind schwere Speerkämpfer. Sie basieren lose auf der Schweizer Garde, die den Vatikan in den letzten fünf Jahrhunderten verteidigt hat (auch wenn die Garde eigentlich erst etwa 700 Jahre nach den Ereignissen dieses Szenarios in Erscheinung trat).

Italian.Text: [BOLD]Strategia:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Queste potenti unità papali sono particolarmente adatte a combattere nemici a cavallo; vanno inoltre bene per difendere le città.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Informazioni:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Con la caduta dell'Impero Romano d'Occidente, la città di Roma era nominalmente sotto la protezione di Bisanzio. I Bizantini però fecero ben poco per supportare Roma e il papa dovette creare un proprio esercito per difendere la Città Santa.[PARAGRAPH:1]I picchieri papali sono lancieri pesanti. Si basano indicativamente sulle unità mercenarie della Guardia Svizzera che hanno difeso il Vaticano negli ultimi cinque secoli (anche se la Guardia è apparsa circa 700 anni dopo gli eventi di questo scenario).

Spanish.Text: [BOLD]Estrategia:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Estas poderosas unidades pontificias son especialmente eficaces contra las unidades montadas, así como para defender ciudades.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Historia:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Con la desaparición del Imperio Romano de occidente, la ciudad de Roma quedó nominalmente bajo la protección de Bizancio. Sin embargo, los bizantinos no hicieron gran cosa para proteger Roma, y los Papas tuvieron que reclutar sus propios ejércitos para defender la Ciudad Santa.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los piqueros papales son lanceros pesados. Estas unidades se basan en los mercenarios de la Guardia Suiza que llevan cinco siglos defendiendo la ciudad del Vaticano (a pesar de que la auténtica Guardia no apareció hasta 700 años después de los sucesos de este escenario).

TEXT.English: These powerful units are particularly adept at battling mounted foes; they are also good at city-defense.

French.Text: Ces puissantes unités pontificales sont expertes dans l'art d'affronter les ennemis montés. Elles sont aussi efficaces pour défendre les villes.

TEXT.German: Diese starken päpstlichen Einheiten sind besonders geschickt im Kampf gegen berittene Feinde, und auch in der Städteverteidigung sind sie recht effektiv.

Italian.Text: Queste potenti unità papali sono particolarmente adatte a combattere nemici a cavallo; vanno inoltre bene per difendere le città.

Spanish.Text: Estas poderosas unidades pontificias son especialmente eficaces contra las unidades montadas, así como para defender ciudades.
Heavy Privateer

TEXT.English: Stronger than a standard Frigate, but weaker than a Ship of the Line, allowing you to harass your enemies without declaring war.
[TAB] The heaviest privateer ship being capable to withstanding the attentions of the Sloops of War that are the bane of the standard privateers and being able to outrun the Ship of the Line.

Spanish.Text: Soldado con espada pesada:Soldados con espada pesada

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]These more powerful sword units can take on moderately-defended cities when backed up by siege units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Heavy swords tend to be longer and heavier (of course) than light swords. They often require two hands to wield, and are typically employed as slashing weapons. A Heavy Swordsman will generally be better-armored than a Light Swordsman, and thus able to both dish out and take more damage.

French.Text: [BOLD]Stratégie :[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ces unités de spadassins plus puissantes peuvent attaquer des villes moyennement défendues avec l'appui d'unités de siège.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Histoire :[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Les épées lourdes sont généralement plus longues et évidemment plus lourdes que les épées légères. Elles se manient souvent à deux mains et servent généralement à porter des coups de taille. Un spadassin lourd a généralement une meilleure armure qu'un spadassin léger, ce qui lui permet d'infliger et de recevoir plus de dégâts.

TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Diese mächtigeren Schwerteinheiten können mäßig befestigte Städte einnehmen, wenn sie von Belagerungseinheiten unterstützt werden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Schwere Schwerter sind länger und (natürlich) schwerer als leichte Schwerter. Man braucht oft beide Hände, um sie zu schwingen, und sie werden als Hiebwaffe eingesetzt. Ein schwerer Schwertkämpfer wird generell besser gepanzert sein als ein leichter und kann dadurch mehr Schaden einstecken und anrichten.

Italian.Text: [BOLD]Strategia:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Queste unità armate con spada, più potenti di quelle normali, possono conquistare città moderatamente difese, con l'aiuto di unità d'assedio.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Informazioni:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Le spade pesanti tendono a essere più lunghe e pesanti (chiaramente) di quelle leggere. Di solito devono essere impugnate a due mani e sono tipicamente usate come armi da fendenti. Uno spadaccino pesante sarà generalmente più corazzato di uno leggero, e quindi in grado di causare e ricevere più danni.

Spanish.Text: [BOLD]Estrategia:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Estas unidades son más poderosas que los espadachines normales y, si cuentan con el respaldo de unidades de asedio, pueden conquistar ciudades no demasiado bien defendidas.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Historia:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Las espadas pesadas eran más largas y, lógicamente,más pesadas que las normales. A menudo debían empuñarse con las dos manos, y normalmente se empleaban como armas cortantes. Normalmente los soldados con espada pesada llevaban mejor armadura que sus equivalentes más ligeros, lo que significa que podían tanto recibir como infligir más daño.

TEXT.English: These more powerful sword units can take on moderately-defended cities when backed up by siege units.

French.Text: Ces unités de spadassins plus puissantes peuvent attaquer des villes moyennement défendues avec l'appui d'unités de siège.

TEXT.German: Diese mächtigeren Schwerteinheiten können mäßig befestigte Städte einnehmen, wenn sie von Belagerungseinheiten unterstützt werden.

Italian.Text: Queste unità armate con spada, più potenti di quelle normali, possono conquistare città moderatamente difese, con l'aiuto di unità d'assedio.

Spanish.Text: Estas unidades son más poderosas que los espadachines normales y, si cuentan con el respaldo de unidades de asedio, pueden conquistar ciudades no demasiado bien defendidas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Horseman is a cavalryman armed with a javelin while scouting and with a long spear while in a battle.
Horseman is the first mounted unit capable of making flanking strikes against enemy siege units.
Hospital Ships are used to heal units.

Spanish.Text: Caballería ligera:Caballerías ligeras

TEXT.English: [TAB]Before the invention of the stirrup, riders stayed atop their horses by knee pressure alone. Close combat was virtually impossible, as the shock from a blow - taken OR given - would very likely pitch the rider onto the ground. While the earliest stirrups appeared around 500 BC, they didn't reach Europe until the sixth or seventh century AD. At this point the European Light Cavalry was born. While lightly armored when compared with Heavy Cavalry or Knights, a Light Cavalry unit can still deliver a shocking blow to infantry or siege units.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Avant l'invention des étriers, les cavaliers se tenaient sur leur monture par la seule pression de leurs genoux. Le combat rapproché était quasiment impossible : un coup, reçu ou porté, avait de grandes chances de faire tomber le cavalier. Les premiers étriers apparurent aux alentours de 500 av. J.-C., mais ils ne furent utilisés en Europe qu'à partir du sixième ou septième siècle ap. J.-C. La cavalerie légère européenne fit alors son apparition. La cavalerie légère, bien que moins protégée que la cavalerie lourde ou que les chevaliers, peut délivrer des charges efficace contre des troupes d'infanterie ou des unités de siège.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Vor der Erfindung der Steigbügel hielten sich Reiter allein durch Druck ihrer Knie im Sattel. Ein Nahkampf war so nahezu unmöglich, da die Erschütterung eines Schlages - ausgeteilt wie eingesteckt - den Reiter wahrscheinlich auf den Boden geschleudert hätte. Auch wenn die ersten Steigbügel bereits aus dem Jahre 500 v. Chr. datieren, waren sie in Europa nicht vor dem 6. oder 7. Jahrhundert n. Chr. zu finden. Zu dieser Zeit wurde die europäische Leichte Kavallerie geboren. Auch wenn sie im Vergleich zur schweren Kavallerie oder den Rittern nur sehr leicht gepanzert waren, kann die Leichte Kavallerie der Infanterie oder Belagerungseinheiten einen schweren Schlag versetzen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Prima dell'invenzione della staffa, i cavalieri rimanevano a cavallo unicamente grazie alla pressione delle ginocchia. Il combattimento ravvicinato era impossibile, visto che con un colpo (dato o ricevuto) il cavaliere sarebbe probabilmente caduto a terra. Pur essendo comparse attorno al 500 a.C., le staffe non raggiunsero l'Europa se non durante il sesto o settimo secolo d.C. A questo punto nacque la cavalleria leggera. Pur essendo poco corazzata, se confrontata con la cavalleria pesante o coi cavalieri, un'unità di cavalleria leggera può comunque infliggere colpi pesanti alla fanteria o a unità d'assedio.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Antes de la invención del estribo, los jinetes se mantenían sobre los caballos utilizando solo la presión de las rodillas. Entrar en combate cuerpo a cuerpo era prácticamente imposible para este tipo de unidades, puesto que era muy probable que el impacto de un golpe, ya fuera recibido o infligido, arrojase al jinete al suelo. Aunque los primeros estribos aparecieron alrededor del año 500 a. C., en Europa no hicieron su aparición hasta los siglos VI o VII d. C. Ése fue el nacimiento de la caballería ligera europea. Aunque está menos armada y peor equipada que la caballería pesada o los caballeros, la caballería ligera puede ser letal frente a las unidades de infantería o de asedio.

TEXT.English: These units can be especially effective against archery or melee units in open terrain.

French.Text: Ces unités peuvent être particulièrement efficaces contre les unités de combat rapproché et les archers en terrain dégagé.

TEXT.German: Diese Einheiten können besonders effektiv gegen unberittene Einheiten auf offenem Feld sein.

Italian.Text: Queste unità sono particolarmente efficaci contro arcieri o unità da combattimento ravvicinato su terreno aperto.

Spanish.Text: Estas unidades pueden ser especialmente eficaces frente a arqueros o a unidades de cuerpo a cuerpo a campo abierto.
Soldado con espada ligera:Soldados con espada ligera

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Chevaliers are medieval knights who follow the code of knightly conduct. The particulars of the code varied, but codes would emphasize the virtues of courage, honor, and service. They were adept at the art of war, trained in fighting in armor, with horses, lances, swords and shields. Chevaliers were taught to excel in the arms, to show courage, to be gallant, loyal and to swear off cowardice and baseness.
These are the strongest pre-gunpowder unit in the game. They are not effective attacking against cities.
[TAB]Watch out soldiers! She's gonna heal your wounds and break your hearts.

Use [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Medics[COLOR_REVERT] to heal troops. They are fast moving, but expensive to produce and maintain. Additionally, Medics require a hospital in the city in which they are built. However, upgrading an [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Explorer[COLOR_REVERT] or adding a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great General[COLOR_REVERT] are great ways to get the precious [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Medic 3[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Woodsman 3[COLOR_REVERT] promotions, both of which add to a unit's healing percentage.
[TAB]Use this missionary to actively spread [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Asatruism[COLOR_REVERT] in friendly cities (or rival cities with whom you have [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders[COLOR_REVERT]).
The Medivac Helicopter is an upgrade to the WW2 Ambulance. It continues the Health Care mod into the Modern Era.

Minutemen were members of teams of select militia men, who vowed to be ready for battle within two minutes of receiving notice. The increased range and accuracy of the rifle, along with a lifetime of hunting to develop marksmanship, earned minutemen sharpshooters a deadly reputation.
The minuteman provides city defense and they have a first strike advantage.
The Modern Medivac Helicopter is an upgrade to the Medivac Helicopter. It continues the Health Care mod into the Modern Era.

Spanish.Text: Infantería montada:Infanterías montadas

TEXT.English: [TAB]Mounted Infantry soldiers use horses to get to the battlefield, but once there they dismount and fight on foot. They rarely take part in charges or other horseback maneuvers, and they tend to suffer badly when engaged in such against trained cavalry units. On the other hand, when fortified on a hill, Mounted Infantry can do serious damage to an attacking Horse Archer or Light Cavalry unit.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les soldats d'infanterie montée se servent de chevaux pour atteindre le champ de bataille mais une fois sur place, ils se battent à pied. Ils ne prennent que rarement part aux charges ou aux manoeuvres à cheval et ont tendance à subir des pertes importantes face à des unités de cavalerie entraînées. Cependant, si elle est placée dans des fortifications sur une colline, l'infanterie montée peut infliger de sérieux dommages à une unité d'archers montés ou de cavalerie légère.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Soldaten der Berittenen Infanterie nutzen Pferde, um aufs Schlachtfeld zu gelangen. Sobald sie es erreicht haben, satteln sie jedoch ab und kämpfen zu Fuß. Sie nehmen nur selten an Vorstößen oder anderen Manövern zu Pferd teil, und wenn sie gegen ausgebildete Einheiten der Kavallerie eingesetzt werden, stecken sie meist viel Schaden ein. Wenn sie gefestigt auf einem Hügel stationiert ist, kann die Berittene Infanterie anrückenden Berittenen Bogenschützen oder Einheiten der Leichten Kavallerie jedoch schweren Schaden zufügen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I soldati della fanteria a cavallo usano i cavalli per arrivare al campo di battaglia ma poi smontano e combattono a piedi. Di rado prendono parte a cariche o altre manovre a cavallo, e tendono a subire malamente gli attacchi delle unità di cavalleria. D'altro canto quando sono fortificate in collina, i fanti a cavallo possono infliggere seri danni ad arcieri a cavallo o cavalleria leggera.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los soldados de la infantería montada usan sus caballos para llegar al campo de batalla, pero una vez allí desmontan y luchan a pie. Solo en raras ocasiones toman parte en cargas u otras maniobras típicas de caballería y, cuando se enfrentan con escuadrones de caballería profesional, normalmente llevan las de perder. Por otro lado, cuando está atrincherada en una colina, la infantería montada puede ser muy peligrosa para los arqueros a caballo o la caballería ligera.

TEXT.English: Use these speedy infantrymen as rapid-reaction forces and to defend hills and forests.

French.Text: Utilisez ces Spadassins pour intervenir rapidement ou pour défendre les collines et les forêts.

TEXT.German: Setzen Sie diese schnellen Infanteriekämpfer als Streitkräfte für schnelle Gegenmaßnahmen und zur Verteidigung von Hügeln und Wäldern ein.

Italian.Text: Usa questi veloci fanti per reagire rapidamente e per difendere colline e foreste.

Spanish.Text: Utiliza a estas veloces unidades de infantería como fuerzas de reacción rápida, así como para defender colinas y bosques.

TEXT.English: The mission of the Police is to safeguard the lives and property of the people in which they serve, to reduce the incidence and fear of crime, and to enhance public safety.
Police provide city protection and they decrease city unrest
Sail gunboats are used to bombard city defences.

In the age of sail, a gunboat was usually a small undecked vessel carrying a single smoothbore cannon in the bow, or just two or three such cannons. A gunboat could carry one or two masts or be oar-powered only, but the single-masted version of about 15 m (49 ft) length was most typical.[when?] Some types of gunboat carried two cannons, or else mounted a number of swivel guns on the railings.
All navies of the sailing era kept a number of gunboats on hand. Gunboats saw extensive use in the Baltic Sea during the late 18th century as they were well-suited for the extensive coastal skerries and archipelagoes of Sweden, Finland and Russia.

[TAB]A [BOLD]Quinquereme[\BOLD] is a type of ancient oar-propelled warship that was used by the Greeks of the Hellenistic period and later by the Carthaginians and Romans, from the 4th century BC to the 1st century. It was developed from the earlier trireme.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]Quinqueremes were even more difficult to make stable than triremes, and the increase in speed was not so great as to give the larger galleys much of an advantage. Therefore smaller navies had a core of trireme warships, while bigger navies like Egypt, Rome and Carthage were able to afford a large number of quinqueremes and polyremes. Their advantage was the protection against ramming attacks and the larger body of marines. Comparing the effect of multiple man oars to one man oars you have to look at several men as not fully participating. Because of the restricted movement a large number of rowers did not propel the vessel with as much of their musclepower as on a one man oar. At this time the Greek homeland had declined as a naval power. Only Macedonia's uniting rule was able to afford these juggernauts in larger numbers and with its decline the fleet had to use cheaper triremes again to keep at least a large number of ships in the battleline. But this type of ship had changed into a heavier warship with the rowers now all protected under deck, much more firepower and marines.
Build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Siege Quinqueremes[COLOR_REVERT] to bombard enemy costal cities.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Quinqueremes de Ascedio[COLOR_REVERT] para bombardear ciudades costeras enemigas.

Spanish.Text: Esclavo:Esclavos

TEXT.English: [TAB]Slaves are workers that are deprived from personal freedom and compelled to work. Slaves are held against their will from the time of their capture, purchase, or birth, and are deprived of the right to leave, to refuse to work, or to receive compensation (such as wages) in return for their labor.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les esclaves sont des ouvriers qui sont privés de la liberté personnelle et obligés de travailler. Des esclaves sont tenus contre leur volonté dès leur capture, achètent, ou naissance, et sont privés de la droite de laisser, de refuser de travailler, ou de recevoir la compensation (telle que des salaires) en échange pour leur travail.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Sklaven sind Arbeitskräfte, die von der persönlichen Freiheit beraubt werden und gezwungen zu arbeiten. Sklaven werden gegen ihren Willen seit ihrer Sicherung gehalten, kaufen oder Geburt und werden das Recht, abzulehnen, oder Ausgleich zu lassen (wie Löhne) als Ausgleich für ihre Arbeit zu empfangen zu arbeiten beraubt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli schiavi sono operai che sono privati da libertà personale e sono costretti a funzionare. Gli schiavi sono tenuti contro la loro volontà a partire dal loro bloccaggio, comprano, o la nascita e sono privati della destra lasciare, rifiutare di funzionare, o di ricevere la compensazione (quali gli stipendi) in cambio dei loro lavori.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los esclavos son los trabajadores se obligan que se privan de la libertad personal y que trabajen. Los esclavos se sostienen contra su voluntad desde su captura, compran, o nacimiento, y se privan de la derecha de dejar, de rechazar trabajar, o recibir la remuneración (tal como salarios) a cambio de su trabajo.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] are enemies captured and used for slave labour, that are killed upon completion of work. Enemy units can only be captured in this manner if you adopt the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Slavery[COLOR_REVERT] civic, and only by units with the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Slaver[COLOR_REVERT] promotion.

[TAB][BOLD]Slinger[\BOLD] is a term that refers to a person who uses a Sling.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]A sling is a projectile weapon typically used to throw a blunt projectile such as a stone. It is also known as the shepherd's sling. A sling has a small cradle or pouch in the middle of two lengths of cord. The sling stone is placed in the pouch. Both cords are held in the hand, then the sling is swung and one of the two cords is released. This frees the projectile to fly on a tangent to the circle made by the pouch's rotation. The sling derives its effectiveness by essentially extending the length of a human arm, thus allowing stones to be thrown several times farther than they could be by hand.[NEWLINE][PARAGRAPH:1]The sling is very inexpensive, and easy to construct . It has historically been used for hunting game and in combat. Today it still interests sportsmen as a survival tool and as an improvised weapon.

Build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Slingers[COLOR_REVERT] to protect your cities at the start of the game, they are not very strong, but they have no support cost and will defend their homes against early barbarians warriors.
TEXT.Spanish: Construye [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Honderos[COLOR_REVERT] para proteger tus ciudades en la era Paleolítica.

TEXT.English: A fast wooden ship strong againt Galleons, Privateers and Brigantines and able to enter Ocean Squares.

[TAB] In the 18th and the earlier part of the 19th centuries, a sloop-of-war was a small sailing warship (also known as one of the escort types) with a single gun deck that carried anything up to eighteen cannons. As the rating system covered all vessels with 20 guns and above, this meant that the term sloop-of-war actually encompassed all the unrated combat vessels including the very small gun-brigs and cutters. In technical terms, even the more specialised bomb vessels and fireships were classed as sloops-of-war, and in practice these were actually employed in the sloop role when not carrying out their specialised functions.
A ship sloop was generally the equivalent of the smaller corvette of the French Navy (although the French term also covered ships up up to 24 guns, which were classed as 'post ships' within the Sixth Rate of the British Navy). The name corvette was subsequently also applied to British vessels, but not until the 1830s.
A sloop-of-war was smaller than a sailing frigate and outside the rating system. In general, a sloop-of-war would be under the command of a master and commander rather than a post captain, although in day-to-day use at sea the commanding officer of any naval vessels would be addressed as "captain". Until 1794 the master and commander strictly speaking held the permenent rank of lieutenant, and reverted to that rank when he gave up command of the sloop-of-war; in 1794 the rank of commander was created. - Wikipedia
More skilled than an apothecary, surgeons can heal soldiers in the battlefield quickly.

Spanish.Text: Caravana Comercial:Caravana Comercial

TEXT.English: [TAB]Trade originated with the start of communication in prehistoric times. Trading was the main facility of prehistoric people, who bartered goods and services from each other. Peter Watson dates the history of long-distance commerce from circa 150,000 years ago. [PARAGRAPH:1]Trade is believed to have taken place throughout much of recorded human history. There is evidence of the exchange of obsidian and flint during the stone age. Materials used for creating jewelry were traded with Egypt since 3000 BCE The Phoenicians were noted sea traders, travelling across the Mediterranean Sea, and as far north as Britain for sources of tin to manufacture bronze. For this purpose they established trade colonies the Greeks called emporia. [PARAGRAPH:1]From the beginning of Greek civilization until the fall of the Roman empire in the 5th century, a financially lucrative trade brought valuable spice to Europe from the far east, including China. Roman commerce allowed their empire to flourish and endure. Their widespread empire produced a stable and secure transportation network that enabled the shipment of trade goods without fear of significant piracy. [PARAGRAPH:1]The fall of the Roman empire, and the succeeding dark ages brought instability to western europe and a near collapse of the trade network. Nevertheless some trade did occur. The Radhanites were a medieval guild of Jewish merchants who allowed trade between the Christians in Europe and the Muslims of the near east. [PARAGRAPH:1]From the 8th century to the 11th century centuries, the Vikings and Varangians traded as they sailed from and to Scandinavia. Vikings sailed to Western Europe, while Varangians to Russia. The Hanseatic League was an alliance of trading cities that maintained a trade monopoly over most of Northern Europe and the Baltic, between the 13th and 17th centuries. [PARAGRAPH:1]The tales of Marco Polo's travels to the far east sparked an interest in the spice trade. Vasco da Gama started the Spice trade in 1498. The spice trade was of major economic importance and helped spur the Age of Exploration. Spices brought to Europe from distant lands were some of the most valuable commodities for their weight, sometimes rivaling gold. [PARAGRAPH:1]In the 16th century, Holland was the centre of free trade, imposing no exchange controls, and advocating the free movement of goods. [PARAGRAPH:1]Trade in the East Indies was dominated by Portugal in the 16th century, the Netherlands in the 17th century, and the British in the 18th century.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le commerce naissait avec le début de communication aux temps préhistoriques. Le commerce était la facilité principale des gens préhistoriques, qui ont troqué des marchandises et des services l'un de l'autre. Peter Watson date l'histoire de commerce à longue distance d'il y a environ 150,000 ans. [PARAGRAPH:1]On croit que le commerce est survenu partout dans une grande partie d'histoire humaine enregistrée. Il y a l'évidence de l'échange d'obsidian et le silex pendant l'âge de pierre. Le matériel utilisé pour créer la bijouterie a été échangé avec l'Egypte depuis 3000 BCE les Phéniciens ont été notés les commerçants marins, voyageant à travers la Méditerranée et comme le nord lointain comme la Grande-Bretagne pour les sources de boîte pour fabriquer du bronze. Pour ce but ils ont établi des colonies commerciales les Grecs appelés le grand magasin. [PARAGRAPH:1]À partir du début de civilisation grecque jusqu'à la chute de l'empire romain au 5ème siècle, un commerce financièrement lucratif a apporté l'épice de valeur en Europe de l'Extrême-Orient, en incluant la Chine. Le commerce romain a permis à leur empire de prospérer et endurer. Leur empire étendu a produit un réseau de transport ferme et sûr qui a permis le chargement de marchandises commerciales sans peur de piratage significatif. [PARAGRAPH:1]La chute de l'empire romain et du Moyen Age réussissant a apporté l'instabilité en Europe occidentale et un près de l'effondrement du réseau commercial. Quand même un peu de commerce s'est vraiment produit. Les Radhanites étaient une guilde médiévale de négociants juifs qui ont permis le commerce entre les Chrétiens en Europe et les Musulmans du Proche-Orient. [PARAGRAPH:1]Du 8ème siècle aux siècles du 11ème siècle, les Vikings et Varangians ont fait du commerce comme ils ont navigué d'et à Scandinavie. Les Vikings ont navigué en Europe occidentale, pendant que Varangians en Russie. La Ligue hanséatique était une alliance de villes commerciales qui ont maintenu un monopole commercial sur la plupart d'Europe septentrionale et le Balte, entre les 13ème et 17ème siècles. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les histoires des voyages de Marco Polo dans l'Extrême-Orient ont suscité un intérêt pour le commerce d'épice. Vasco da Gama a commencé le commerce d'Épice dans 1498. Le commerce d'épice a été de l'importance économique importante et a aidé à encourager l'Âge d'Exploration. Les épices apportées en Europe des terrains lointains étaient certains des articles les plus de valeur pour leur poids, en égalant quelquefois de l'or. [PARAGRAPH:1]Au 16ème siècle, les Pays-Bas étaient le centre de libre-échange, n'en imposant aucunes commandes de change et en recommandant le mouvement libre de marchandises. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le commerce dans l'Indies Est a été dominé par le Portugal au 16ème siècle, les Pays-Bas au 17ème siècle et les Britanniques au 18ème siècle.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Handel entstand mit dem Anfang der Kommunikation in der Vorgeschichte. Der Handel war die Hauptmöglichkeit von vorgeschichtlichen Leuten, die Waren und Dienstleistungen von einander umtauschten. Peter Watson datiert auf die Geschichte des Langstreckenhandels von um vor 150,000 Jahren. [PARAGRAPH:1]Wie man glaubt, hat Handel überall in viel registrierter menschlicher Geschichte stattgefunden. Es gibt Beweise des Austausches von obsidian und Zündstein während der Steinzeit. Materialien verwendet, um Schmucksachen zu schaffen, wurden mit Ägypten seit 3000 BCE getauscht Die Phönizier waren bemerkte Seehändler, über Mittelmeer, und als weiter Norden als Großbritannien für Quellen von Dose reisend, um Bronze zu verfertigen. Zu diesem Zweck gründeten sie Handelskolonien, die die Griechen emporia nannten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Vom Anfang der griechischen Zivilisation bis zum Fall des römischen Reiches im 5. Jahrhundert brachte ein finanziell lukrativer Handel wertvolles Gewürz nach Europa vom Fernen Osten einschließlich Chinas. Römischer Handel erlaubte ihrem Reich, zu gedeihen und anzudauern. Ihr weit verbreitetes Reich erzeugte ein stabiles und sicheres Transport-Netz, das die Sendung von Handelswaren ohne Angst vor der bedeutenden illegalen Vervielfältigung ermöglichte. [PARAGRAPH:1]Der Fall des römischen Reiches, und des folgenden finsteren Mittelalters brachte Instabilität nach Westeuropa und einen nahen Zusammenbruch des Handelsnetzes. Dennoch kam etwas Handel wirklich vor. Die Radhanites waren eine mittelalterliche Innung von jüdischen Großhändlern, die Handel zwischen den Christen in Europa und den Moslems des Nahen Ostens erlaubten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Vom 8. Jahrhundert bis zu den Jahrhunderten des 11. Jahrhunderts den Wikingern und getauschtem Varangians wie segelten sie von und bis Skandinavien. Wikinger segelten nach Westeuropa, während Varangians nach Russland. Die Hanse war eine Verbindung von Handelsstädten, die ein Handelsmonopol über den grössten Teil Nordeuropas und die Ostsee zwischen den 13. und 17. Jahrhunderten aufrechterhielten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die Märchen des Reisens von Marco Polo nach dem Fernen Osten befeuerten ein Interesse am Gewürz-Handel. Vasco da Gama fing den Gewürz-Handel mit 1498 an. Der Gewürz-Handel war von Hauptwirtschaftswichtigkeit und half, das Alter der Erforschung zu spornen. Gewürze gebracht nach Europa von entfernten Ländern waren einige der wertvollsten Waren für ihr Gewicht, manchmal mit Gold konkurrierend. [PARAGRAPH:1]Im 16. Jahrhundert war Holland das Zentrum des Freihandels, keine Devisenbewirtschaftungen auferlegend, und die freie Bewegung von Waren verteidigend. [PARAGRAPH:1]Der Handel mit dem Östlichen Indies wurde durch Portugal im 16. Jahrhundert, die Niederlande im 17. Jahrhundert, und die Briten im 18. Jahrhundert beherrscht.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il mestiere ha provenuto con l'inizio di comunicazione nei tempi preistorici. Il commercio era la facilità principale di persone preistoriche, che ha barattato le merci ed i servizi da l'un l'altro. Peter Watson data la storia di commercio di lungo-distanza da intorno a 150.000 anni fa. [PARAGRAPH:1]Il mestiere è creduto avere avuto luogo in ogni parte molto di storia registrata umana. Ci è la prova dello scambio di obsidian e la selce durante l'età della pietra. I materiali usati per la gioielleria di creare sono stato commerciati con Egitto poiché 3000 BCE che Il Phoenicians sono stato notati i commercianti di mare, viaggiando attraverso il Mare mediterraneo, ed il come estremo nord come Gran Bretagna per le fonti di stagno di fabbricare il bronzo. A questo scopo hanno stabilito le colonie di mestiere i greci hanno chiamato degli empori. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dall'inizio di civilizzazione greca fino alla caduta dell'impero romano nel secolo 5, un mestiere finanziariamente lucroso ha portato lo spice di valore a Europa dall'estremo oriente, includendo Cina. Il commercio romano ha consentito il loro impero prosperare e perseverare. Il loro impero esteso ha prodotto una stalla ed ottiene il network di trasporto che ha permesso la spedizione di merci di mestiere senza la paura di pirateria significativa. [PARAGRAPH:1]La caduta dell'impero romano, ed il che riuscindo età oscura ha portato l'instabilità a Europa occidentale ed un collasso prossimo del network di mestiere. Tuttavia del mestiere è accaduto. Il Radhanites erano una corporazione medievale di commercianti Ebrei che ha consentito il mestiere tra i cristiani in europa ed i Musulmani del si avvicina all'est. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dal secolo 8 ai secoli di secolo 11, il Vikings e Varangians hanno commerciato come hanno navigato da ed a Scandinavia. Il Vikings ha navigato a Europa Occidentale, mentre Varangians a Russia. La Lega di Hanseatic era un'alleanza di città commerciali che ha mantenuto un monopolio di mestiere sopra la maggior parte di Europa del nord ed il Baltico, tra i secoli 13 e 17. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le favole di viaggi del Polo di Marco all'estremo oriente hanno acceso un interesse nel mestiere di spice. Gama di da di Vasco ha cominciato il mestiere di Spice in 1498. Il mestiere di spice era di maggiore importanza economica e lo sperone aiutato l'Età di Esplorazione. Lo Spices ha portato a Europa dalle terre distanti erano alcuni delle merci più di valore per il loro peso, il loro a volte oro di rivaling. [PARAGRAPH:1]Nel secolo 16, Olanda era il centro di libero commercio, imponendo nessuni controlli di scambio, e difendere il movimento libero di merci. [PARAGRAPH:1]Commerciare nell'Indie Orientale è stato dominato da Portogallo nel secolo 16, Paesi Bassi nel secolo 17, e gli inglesi nel secolo 18.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El comercio provino con el principio de comunicación en tiempos prehistóricos. El comercio era la instalación principal de la gente prehistórica, que cambió bienes y servicios el uno del otro. Peter Watson data la historia del comercio de fondo de hacia hace 150,000 años. [PARAGRAPH:1]Se cree que el comercio ha ocurrido en todas partes de la mayor parte de la historia humana registrada. Hay pruebas del cambio de obsidiana y sílex durante la Edad de Piedra. Los materiales usados para crear joyería fueron cambiados con Egipto desde 3000 BCE los Fenicios fueron notados comerciantes de mar, que viajan a través del Mar Mediterráneo, y como el norte lejano como Gran Bretaña para fuentes de lata para fabricar el bronce. Para este fin ellos establecieron colonias comerciales los griegos llamados emporios. [PARAGRAPH:1]A partir del principio de la civilización griega hasta la caída del Imperio romano en el 5o siglo, un comercio económicamente lucrativo trajo la especia valiosa a Europa del oriente lejano, incluso China. El comercio romano permitió que su Imperio prosperara y durara. Su Imperio extendido produjo una red de transporte estable y segura que permitió el envío de bienes comerciales sin el miedo de la piratería significativa. [PARAGRAPH:1]La caída del Imperio romano, y la Alta Edad Media sucesiva trajo la inestabilidad a Europa occidental y un cerca del colapso de la red comercial. Sin embargo un poco de comercio ocurrió realmente. Los Radhanites eran un gremio medieval de comerciantes judíos que permitieron el comercio entre los Cristianos en Europa y los Musulmanes del Oriente Próximo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Del 8o siglo a los siglos del 11o siglo, los Vikingos y Varangians cambiado cuando ellos fueron en barco de y a Escandinavia. Los vikingos fueron en barco a Europa Occidental, mientras Varangians a Rusia. La Liga Hanseatic era una alianza de ciudades comerciales que mantuvieron un monopolio comercial sobre la mayor parte de Europa del Norte y el Báltico, entre los 13os y 17os siglos. [PARAGRAPH:1]Los cuentos de los viajes de Marco Polo al oriente lejano provocaron un interés al comercio de especia. Vasco da Gama comenzó el comercio de Especia en 1498. El comercio de especia tuvo la importancia económica principal y ayudó a espolear la Edad de Exploración. Las especias traídas a Europa de tierras distantes eran algunas materias más valiosas para su peso, a veces rivalizando con el oro. [PARAGRAPH:1]En el 16o siglo, Holanda era el centro de cambio libre, no imponiendo ningunos controles de divisas, y abogando por el movimiento libre de bienes. [PARAGRAPH:1]El comercio en Indies del este fue dominado por Portugal en el 16o siglo, los Países Bajos en el 17o siglo, y el Británico en el 18o siglo.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The galley was the first ship designed for war. Introduced by the Greeks, galleys were powered by banks of oars on each side, manned by well-trained oarsmen. These oarsmen were highly paid professionals or patriotic citizens, not slaves and prisoners as depicted in fiction. A huge, bronze "beak" mounted at the bow of the ship was used to ram and sink enemy ships. Because of its long, narrow hull, the galley was very unstable in all but the calmest waters, and as a consequence its crew rarely ventured out of sight of land for long periods of time, lest the ship be caught in a storm and sunk.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La galère fut le premier navire conçu pour la guerre. Crée par les Grecs, elle était propulsée par plusieurs rangs de rameurs bien entraînés, installés de chaque côté du bateau. Contrairement à ce que l'on pense, ces rameurs étaient des professionnels ou des volontaires, et non des esclaves ou des prisonniers. Un énorme "éperon" en bronze était fixé sur la proue pour éperonner et couler les navires ennemis. La longue coque étroite du bateau le rendait instable dès que la mer s'agitait un peu, et les équipages évitaient généralement de s'aventurer trop longtemps loin des côtes, de peur qu'une tempête survienne et coule le navire.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die von den Griechen in der Antike entworfene und gebaute Triere war das erste Kriegsschiff überhaupt. Auf beiden Seiten des Schiffes befanden sich Ruderbänke, an denen erfahrene Ruderer für volle Fahrt sorgten. Entgegen der häufig vertretenen Theorie, dass es sich dabei um Sklaven oder Gefangene handelte, bestand die Rudermannschaft normalerweise aus gut bezahlten, fachkundigen Seeleuten oder patriotischen Bürgern. Am Bug befand sich ein riesiger, meist aus Bronze gefertigter Schnabel, mit dessen Hilfe feindliche Schiffe gerammt und versenkt werden konnten. Da die Triere wegen ihres langen, schmalen Rumpfs bei rauer See sehr instabil wurde, entfernte sie sich selten weit von der Küste, denn jeder Sturm hätte ausgereicht, um sie zum Kentern zu bringen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La galea è stata la prima nave appositamente progettata per la guerra. Introdotta dai Greci, quest'imbarcazione si muoveva grazie alla presenza di file di remi su ciascun lato, utilizzati da rematori ben addestrati. Questi uomini erano professionisti con un ottimo salario o cittadini patriottici, non schiavi e prigionieri come si crede. Un grosso "rostro" di bronzo, montato sulla prua della nave, veniva utilizzato per colpire e affondare le navi nemiche. A causa del suo scafo lungo e stretto, la galea era molto instabile al di fuori delle acque placide: di conseguenza, l'equipaggio non perdeva mai di vista la costa, proprio per evitare pericoli durante la navigazione.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La galera fue el primer barco diseñado para la guerra. Inventadas por los griegos, las galeras contaban con bancos de remos a ambos lados, manejados por marineros avezados. Los remeros eran profesionales muy bien remunerados o patriotas, no los esclavos y prisioneros que aparecen en las películas. Un enorme ?espolón? de bronce instalado en la proa de la nave se utilizaba para embestir y hundir las embarcaciones enemigas. Debido a su casco alargado y de poco calado, la galera solo era estable en las aguas más tranquilas, y como consecuencia de ello, raramente se alejaba de la costa durante largos periodos de tiempo, no fuera a sucumbir en alguna tormenta.

TEXT.English: War Galley is more combat efficient navy vessel than the Galley and make them better against other early oar based ships. They cannot enter ocean spaces.
